```diff
+     &#39;Integrated Circuits&#39;: [&#39;semiconductor&#39;, &#39;chip&#39;, &#39;wafer&#39;, &#39;foundry&#39;, &#39;chipmaker&#39;, &#39;integrated circuit&#39;],
+     &#39;Biopharmaceuticals&#39;: [&#39;pharma&#39;, &#39;biotech&#39;, &#39;drug&#39;, &#39;medicine&#39;, &#39;healthcare&#39;, &#39;medical&#39;, &#39;clinic&#39;, &#39;vaccine&#39;, &#39;therapeutic&#39;],
+     &#39;New Energy Vehicles&#39;: [&#39;electric vehicle&#39;, &#39;ev &#39;, &#39;battery&#39;, &#39;auto&#39;, &#39;automotive&#39;, &#39;vehicle&#39;],
+     &#39;Mineral Resources&#39;: [&#39;mining&#39;, &#39;mineral&#39;, &#39;copper&#39;, &#39;lithium&#39;, &#39;iron ore&#39;, &#39;cobalt&#39;, &#39;nickel&#39;, &#39;zinc&#39;, &#39;gold&#39;, &#39;silver&#39;, &#39;coal&#39;, &#39;metal&#39;]
+ }
+ 
+ EXCLUDE_PATTERNS = {
+     &#39;Biopharmaceuticals&#39;: [&#39;hospitality&#39;],
+     &#39;New Energy Vehicles&#39;: [&#39;carlson&#39;, &#39;carmike&#39;, &#39;carrefour&#39;],
+     &#39;Mineral Resources&#39;: [&#39;goldman&#39;]
+ }
+ 
+ @st.cache_data
+ def load_data():
+     &quot;&quot;&quot;Load and process data&quot;&quot;&quot;
+     df = pd.read_csv(&#39;china_investment_tracker.csv&#39;)
+     
+     # Clean amount
+     df[&#39;Amount&#39;] = df[&#39;Millions&#39;].str.replace(&#39;$&#39;, &#39;&#39;, regex=False).str.replace(&#39;,&#39;, &#39;&#39;).str.strip()
+     df[&#39;Amount&#39;] = pd.to_numeric(df[&#39;Amount&#39;], errors=&#39;coerce&#39;)
+     
+     return df
+ 
+ def classify_accurate(row):
+     &quot;&quot;&quot;Classify investment by industry&quot;&quot;&quot;
+     text = (str(row.get(&#39;Sector&#39;, &#39;&#39;)) + &#39; &#39; + 
+             str(row.get(&#39;Subsector&#39;, &#39;&#39;)) + &#39; &#39; + 
+             str(row.get(&#39;Partner/Target&#39;, &#39;&#39;)) + &#39; &#39; + 
+             str(row.get(&#39;Investor&#39;, &#39;&#39;))).lower()
+     
+     matches = {}
+     
+     for industry, keywords in INDUSTRY_KEYWORDS.items():
+         should_exclude = False
+         if industry in EXCLUDE_PATTERNS:
+             for exclude_word in EXCLUDE_PATTERNS[industry]:
+                 if exclude_word in text:
+                     should_exclude = True
+                     break
+         
+         if should_exclude:
+             continue
+         
+         for keyword in keywords:
+             if keyword in text:
+                 matches[industry] = keyword
+                 break
+     
+     return list(matches.keys())
+ 
+ @st.cache_data
+ def process_data(df):
+     &quot;&quot;&quot;Process and classify data&quot;&quot;&quot;
+     df[&#39;Industries&#39;] = df.apply(classify_accurate, axis=1)
+     df_expanded = df.explode(&#39;Industries&#39;)
+     df_expanded = df_expanded[df_expanded[&#39;Industries&#39;].notna()].copy()
+     return df_expanded
+ 
+ def calculate_hhi(country_amounts):
+     &quot;&quot;&quot;Calculate HHI index&quot;&quot;&quot;
+     total = country_amounts.sum()
+     if total == 0:
+         return 0
+     shares = (country_amounts / total * 100)
+     hhi = (shares ** 2).sum()
+     return hhi
+ 
+ # Main app
+ def main():
+     # Header
+     st.markdown(&#39;&lt;div class=&quot;main-header&quot;&gt;ğŸŒ China Outbound Investment Analysis&lt;/div&gt;&#39;, unsafe_allow_html=True)
+     st.markdown(&#39;&lt;div style=&quot;text-align: center; color: #7f8c8d; margin-bottom: 2rem;&quot;&gt;Beijing Belt &amp; Road Enterprise Training - Interactive Dashboard&lt;/div&gt;&#39;, unsafe_allow_html=True)
+     
+     # Load data
+     with st.spinner(&#39;Loading data...&#39;):
+         df = load_data()
+         df_expanded = process_data(df)
+     
+     # Sidebar filters
+     st.sidebar.header(&quot;ğŸ” Filters&quot;)
+     
+     # Industry selection
+     industries = list(INDUSTRY_KEYWORDS.keys())
+     selected_industries = st.sidebar.multiselect(
+         &quot;Select Industries&quot;,
+         industries,
+         default=industries
+     )
+     
+     # Year range
+     year_min, year_max = int(df[&#39;Year&#39;].min()), int(df[&#39;Year&#39;].max())
+     year_range = st.sidebar.slider(
+         &quot;Select Year Range&quot;,
+         year_min, year_max,
+         (year_min, year_max)
+     )
+     
+     # Country filter
+     all_countries = sorted(df_expanded[&#39;Country&#39;].dropna().unique())
+     selected_countries = st.sidebar.multiselect(
+         &quot;Filter by Country (Optional)&quot;,
+         all_countries,
+         default=[]
+     )
+     
+     # Amount filter
+     st.sidebar.subheader(&quot;Investment Amount Range&quot;)
+     min_amount = st.sidebar.number_input(&quot;Min Amount (Million USD)&quot;, value=0, step=100)
+     max_amount = st.sidebar.number_input(&quot;Max Amount (Million USD)&quot;, value=50000, step=100)
+     
+     # Apply filters
+     filtered_df = df_expanded[
+         (df_expanded[&#39;Industries&#39;].isin(selected_industries)) &amp;
+         (df_expanded[&#39;Year&#39;] &gt;= year_range[0]) &amp;
+         (df_expanded[&#39;Year&#39;] &lt;= year_range[1]) &amp;
+         (df_expanded[&#39;Amount&#39;] &gt;= min_amount) &amp;
+         (df_expanded[&#39;Amount&#39;] &lt;= max_amount)
+     ]
+     
+     if selected_countries:
+         filtered_df = filtered_df[filtered_df[&#39;Country&#39;].isin(selected_countries)]
+     
+     # Overview metrics
+     st.markdown(&#39;&lt;div class=&quot;sub-header&quot;&gt;ğŸ“Š Overview&lt;/div&gt;&#39;, unsafe_allow_html=True)
+     
+     col1, col2, col3, col4 = st.columns(4)
+     
+     with col1:
+         st.metric(
+             &quot;Total Projects&quot;,
+             f&quot;{len(filtered_df):,}&quot;,
+             delta=None
+         )
+     
+     with col2:
+         total_investment = filtered_df[&#39;Amount&#39;].sum()
+         st.metric(
+             &quot;Total Investment&quot;,
+             f&quot;${total_investment/1000:.1f}B&quot;,
+             delta=None
+         )
+     
+     with col3:
+         avg_investment = filtered_df[&#39;Amount&#39;].mean()
+         st.metric(
+             &quot;Average Investment&quot;,
+             f&quot;${avg_investment:.1f}M&quot;,
+             delta=None
+         )
+     
+     with col4:
+         num_countries = filtered_df[&#39;Country&#39;].nunique()
+         st.metric(
+             &quot;Countries&quot;,
+             f&quot;{num_countries}&quot;,
+             delta=None
+         )
+     
+     # Tabs for different views
+     tab1, tab2, tab3, tab4, tab5 = st.tabs([
+         &quot;ğŸ“ˆ Trends&quot;, 
+         &quot;ğŸŒ Geographic&quot;, 
+         &quot;ğŸ¯ Concentration&quot;, 
+         &quot;ğŸ“‹ Data Explorer&quot;,
+         &quot;ğŸ’¡ Insights&quot;
+     ])
+     
+     with tab1:
+         st.markdown(&quot;### Investment Trends Over Time&quot;)
+         
+         # Time series by industry
+         for industry in selected_industries:
+             industry_df = filtered_df[filtered_df[&#39;Industries&#39;] == industry]
+             
+             if len(industry_df) == 0:
+                 continue
+             
+             yearly = industry_df.groupby(&#39;Year&#39;).agg({
+                 &#39;Amount&#39;: [&#39;sum&#39;, &#39;count&#39;]
+             }).reset_index()
+             yearly.columns = [&#39;Year&#39;, &#39;Total_Investment&#39;, &#39;Project_Count&#39;]
+             
+             # Create dual-axis chart
+             fig = make_subplots(specs=[[{&quot;secondary_y&quot;: True}]])
+             
+             fig.add_trace(
+                 go.Bar(x=yearly[&#39;Year&#39;], y=yearly[&#39;Total_Investment&#39;], 
+                        name=&#39;Investment Amount&#39;, marker_color=&#39;steelblue&#39;),
+                 secondary_y=False,
+             )
+             
+             fig.add_trace(
+                 go.Scatter(x=yearly[&#39;Year&#39;], y=yearly[&#39;Project_Count&#39;], 
+                           name=&#39;Project Count&#39;, mode=&#39;lines+markers&#39;,
+                           marker=dict(size=8, color=&#39;red&#39;), line=dict(width=2, color=&#39;red&#39;)),
+                 secondary_y=True,
+             )
+             
+             fig.update_xaxes(title_text=&quot;Year&quot;)
+             fig.update_yaxes(title_text=&quot;Investment (Million USD)&quot;, secondary_y=False)
+             fig.update_yaxes(title_text=&quot;Number of Projects&quot;, secondary_y=True)
+             
+             fig.update_layout(
+                 title_text=f&quot;{industry} - Investment Trend&quot;,
+                 hovermode=&#39;x unified&#39;,
+                 height=400
+             )
+             
+             st.plotly_chart(fig, use_container_width=True)
+     
+     with tab2:
+         st.markdown(&quot;### Geographic Distribution&quot;)
+         
+         col1, col2 = st.columns([2, 1])
+         
+         with col1:
+             # Top countries by industry
+             industry_select = st.selectbox(&quot;Select Industry for Map&quot;, selected_industries)
+             
+             industry_df = filtered_df[filtered_df[&#39;Industries&#39;] == industry_select]
+             
+             country_stats = industry_df.groupby(&#39;Country&#39;).agg({
+                 &#39;Amount&#39;: [&#39;sum&#39;, &#39;count&#39;]
+             }).reset_index()
+             country_stats.columns = [&#39;Country&#39;, &#39;Total_Investment&#39;, &#39;Project_Count&#39;]
+             country_stats = country_stats.sort_values(&#39;Total_Investment&#39;, ascending=False).head(15)
+             
+             fig = px.bar(
+                 country_stats,
+                 x=&#39;Total_Investment&#39;,
+                 y=&#39;Country&#39;,
+                 orientation=&#39;h&#39;,
+                 title=f&#39;{industry_select} - Top 15 Destinations&#39;,
+                 labels={&#39;Total_Investment&#39;: &#39;Investment (Million USD)&#39;, &#39;Country&#39;: &#39;&#39;},
+                 color=&#39;Total_Investment&#39;,
+                 color_continuous_scale=&#39;Teal&#39;
+             )
+             fig.update_layout(height=500, showlegend=False)
+             st.plotly_chart(fig, use_container_width=True)
+         
+         with col2:
+             st.markdown(&quot;#### Top Destinations&quot;)
+             for idx, row in country_stats.head(10).iterrows():
+                 st.markdown(f&quot;&quot;&quot;
+                 **{row[&#39;Country&#39;]}**  
+                 ğŸ’° ${row[&#39;Total_Investment&#39;]:,.0f}M  
+                 ğŸ“Š {int(row[&#39;Project_Count&#39;])} projects
+                 &quot;&quot;&quot;)
+     
+     with tab3:
+         st.markdown(&quot;### Investment Concentration Analysis&quot;)
+         
+         concentration_data = []
+         
+         for industry in selected_industries:
+             industry_df = filtered_df[filtered_df[&#39;Industries&#39;] == industry]
+             
+             if len(industry_df) == 0:
+                 continue
+             
+             country_amounts = industry_df.groupby(&#39;Country&#39;)[&#39;Amount&#39;].sum().sort_values(ascending=False)
+             total_amount = country_amounts.sum()
+             
+             if total_amount == 0:
+                 continue
+             
+             shares = (country_amounts / total_amount * 100)
+             hhi = calculate_hhi(country_amounts)
+             top3_share = shares.head(3).sum()
+             
+             concentration_data.append({
+                 &#39;Industry&#39;: industry,
+                 &#39;HHI_Index&#39;: round(hhi, 1),
+                 &#39;Top3_Share_%&#39;: round(top3_share, 1),
+                 &#39;Num_Countries&#39;: len(country_amounts),
+                 &#39;Top_Destination&#39;: country_amounts.index[0] if len(country_amounts) &gt; 0 else &#39;N/A&#39;
+             })
+         
+         if concentration_data:
+             conc_df = pd.DataFrame(concentration_data)
+             
+             col1, col2 = st.columns(2)
+             
+             with col1:
+                 fig = px.bar(
+                     conc_df,
+                     x=&#39;Industry&#39;,
+                     y=&#39;HHI_Index&#39;,
+                     title=&#39;HHI Index by Industry&#39;,
+                     color=&#39;HHI_Index&#39;,
+                     color_continuous_scale=&#39;RdYlGn_r&#39;,
+                     labels={&#39;HHI_Index&#39;: &#39;HHI Index&#39;}
+                 )
+                 fig.add_hline(y=1000, line_dash=&quot;dash&quot;, line_color=&quot;green&quot;, 
+                              annotation_text=&quot;Low Concentration&quot;)
+                 fig.add_hline(y=1800, line_dash=&quot;dash&quot;, line_color=&quot;red&quot;,
+                              annotation_text=&quot;High Concentration&quot;)
+                 fig.update_layout(height=400, showlegend=False)
+                 st.plotly_chart(fig, use_container_width=True)
+             
+             with col2:
+                 fig = px.bar(
+                     conc_df,
+                     x=&#39;Industry&#39;,
+                     y=&#39;Top3_Share_%&#39;,
+                     title=&#39;Top 3 Countries Share&#39;,
+                     color=&#39;Top3_Share_%&#39;,
+                     color_continuous_scale=&#39;Blues&#39;,
+                     labels={&#39;Top3_Share_%&#39;: &#39;Share (%)&#39;}
+                 )
+                 fig.add_hline(y=50, line_dash=&quot;dash&quot;, line_color=&quot;orange&quot;,
+                              annotation_text=&quot;50% Reference&quot;)
+                 fig.update_layout(height=400, showlegend=False)
+                 st.plotly_chart(fig, use_container_width=True)
+             
+             st.dataframe(conc_df, use_container_width=True)
+     
+     with tab4:
+         st.markdown(&quot;### Data Explorer&quot;)
+         
+         # Display filtered data
+         display_df = filtered_df[[
+             &#39;Year&#39;, &#39;Month&#39;, &#39;Industries&#39;, &#39;Investor&#39;, &#39;Amount&#39;, 
+             &#39;Partner/Target&#39;, &#39;Country&#39;, &#39;Region&#39;, &#39;Sector&#39;, &#39;Subsector&#39;
+         ]].sort_values(&#39;Amount&#39;, ascending=False)
+         
+         st.dataframe(display_df, use_container_width=True, height=500)
+         
+         # Download button
+         csv = display_df.to_csv(index=False).encode(&#39;utf-8&#39;)
+         st.download_button(
+             label=&quot;ğŸ“¥ Download Data as CSV&quot;,
+             data=csv,
+             file_name=&#39;china_investment_filtered.csv&#39;,
+             mime=&#39;text/csv&#39;,
+         )
+     
+     with tab5:
+         st.markdown(&quot;### Key Insights&quot;)
+         
+         for industry in selected_industries:
+             industry_df = filtered_df[filtered_df[&#39;Industries&#39;] == industry]
+             
+             if len(industry_df) == 0:
+                 continue
+             
+             st.markdown(f&quot;#### {industry}&quot;)
+             
+             total_inv = industry_df[&#39;Amount&#39;].sum()
+             num_projects = len(industry_df)
+             avg_inv = industry_df[&#39;Amount&#39;].mean()
+             
+             top_country = industry_df.groupby(&#39;Country&#39;)[&#39;Amount&#39;].sum().sort_values(ascending=False)
+             
+             col1, col2 = st.columns([2, 1])
+             
+             with col1:
+                 st.markdown(f&quot;&quot;&quot;
+                 **Investment Summary:**
+                 - Total Investment: **${total_inv:,.0f}M** (${total_inv/1000:.1f}B)
+                 - Number of Projects: **{num_projects}**
+                 - Average Investment: **${avg_inv:,.0f}M**
+                 - Top Destination: **{top_country.index[0]}** (${top_country.iloc[0]:,.0f}M)
+                 
+                 **Risk Assessment:**
+                 &quot;&quot;&quot;)
+                 
+                 # Calculate concentration level
+                 hhi = calculate_hhi(top_country)
+                 if hhi &gt; 1800:
+                     st.error(&quot;âš ï¸ High concentration - Significant geopolitical risk&quot;)
+                 elif hhi &gt; 1000:
+                     st.warning(&quot;â†’ Medium concentration - Moderate risk level&quot;)
+                 else:
+                     st.success(&quot;âœ“ Low concentration - Diversified risk&quot;)
+             
+             with col2:
+                 # Top 5 countries
+                 st.markdown(&quot;**Top 5 Destinations:**&quot;)
+                 for idx, (country, amount) in enumerate(top_country.head(5).items(), 1):
+                     pct = (amount / total_inv * 100) if total_inv &gt; 0 else 0
+                     st.markdown(f&quot;{idx}. {country} ({pct:.1f}%)&quot;)
+             
+             st.markdown(&quot;---&quot;)
+ 
+ if __name__ == &quot;__main__&quot;:
+     main()
+ 
```

</details>

</tool-use>

```diff
+ # China Outbound Investment Analysis - Interactive Dashboard
+ 
+ An interactive Streamlit dashboard for analyzing Chinese enterprises&#39; outbound investment patterns across key industries.
+ 
+ ## ğŸ¯ Target Industries
+ 
+ 1. **Integrated Circuits** (4 projects) - High geopolitical risk case study
+ 2. **Biopharmaceuticals** (30 projects) - Healthcare sector analysis
+ 3. **New Energy Vehicles** (225 projects) - Major automotive investments
+ 4. **Mineral Resources** (412 projects) - Most comprehensive dataset
+ 
+ ## ğŸš€ Quick Start
+ 
+ ### Local Development
+ 
+ 1. **Install dependencies:**
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ pip install -r requirements.txt
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ 2. **Run the app:**
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ streamlit run app.py
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ 3. **Open in browser:**
+ The app will automatically open at &#96;http://localhost:8501&#96;
+ 
+ ## ğŸ“Š Features
+ 
+ ### Interactive Filters
+ - **Industry Selection**: Choose one or multiple industries
+ - **Time Range**: Filter by year range (2005-2025)
+ - **Country Filter**: Focus on specific countries
+ - **Investment Amount**: Set min/max investment thresholds
+ 
+ ### Analysis Views
+ 
+ #### ğŸ“ˆ Trends Tab
+ - Time series analysis for each industry
+ - Dual-axis charts showing investment amount and project count
+ - Identify peak investment periods and policy shifts
+ 
+ #### ğŸŒ Geographic Tab
+ - Top 15 investment destinations per industry
+ - Interactive bar charts with detailed statistics
+ - Quick country-level summaries
+ 
+ #### ğŸ¯ Concentration Tab
+ - HHI (Herfindahl-Hirschman Index) analysis
+ - Top 3 countries share visualization
+ - Risk concentration assessment
+ 
+ #### ğŸ“‹ Data Explorer
+ - Full dataset table with sorting and filtering
+ - Download filtered data as CSV
+ - Detailed project information
+ 
+ #### ğŸ’¡ Insights Tab
+ - Automated risk assessments
+ - Key statistics per industry
+ - Top destination rankings
+ 
+ ## ğŸŒ Deploy to Streamlit Cloud
+ 
+ ### Method 1: Via GitHub
+ 
+ 1. **Create a GitHub repository:**
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ git init
+ git add .
+ git commit -m &quot;Initial commit&quot;
+ git remote add origin &lt;your-repo-url&gt;
+ git push -u origin main
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ 2. **Deploy on Streamlit Cloud:**
+    - Go to [share.streamlit.io](https://share.streamlit.io)
+    - Click &quot;New app&quot;
+    - Connect your GitHub repository
+    - Select &#96;app.py&#96; as the main file
+    - Click &quot;Deploy&quot;
+ 
+ ### Method 2: Direct Upload
+ 
+ 1. Go to [share.streamlit.io](https://share.streamlit.io)
+ 2. Upload your files directly
+ 3. Streamlit will automatically detect &#96;requirements.txt&#96;
+ 
+ ## ğŸ“ Required Files
+ 
+ Make sure these files are in the same directory:
+ - &#96;app.py&#96; - Main Streamlit application
+ - &#96;china_investment_tracker.csv&#96; - Investment data
+ - &#96;requirements.txt&#96; - Python dependencies
+ - &#96;README.md&#96; - This file
+ 
+ ## ğŸ“ Training Usage
+ 
+ ### For Presenters:
+ 1. Use filters to focus on specific industries relevant to the audience
+ 2. Show real-time data exploration during Q&amp;A
+ 3. Generate custom visualizations on the fly
+ 4. Export filtered data for follow-up discussions
+ 
+ ### For Participants:
+ 1. Self-serve data exploration after training
+ 2. Compare different industries and time periods
+ 3. Identify investment opportunities in specific countries
+ 4. Download data for further analysis
+ 
+ ## ğŸ“Š Data Notes
+ 
+ - **Time Period**: 2005-2025
+ - **Classification Method**: Strict keyword matching to avoid false positives
+ - **Integrated Circuits**: Only 4 projects reflect tight M&amp;A restrictions
+ - **AI Industry**: Excluded due to insufficient historical data
+ 
+ ## ğŸ”§ Customization
+ 
+ ### Adding New Industries
+ 
+ Edit &#96;INDUSTRY_KEYWORDS&#96; in &#96;app.py&#96;:
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;python
+ INDUSTRY_KEYWORDS = {
+     &#39;Your Industry&#39;: [&#39;keyword1&#39;, &#39;keyword2&#39;, ...],
+     ...
+ }
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Adjusting Filters
+ 
+ Modify the sidebar section in &#96;app.py&#96; to add new filter options.
+ 
+ ### Changing Chart Styles
+ 
+ Update Plotly chart configurations for different visualizations.
+ 
+ ## ğŸ“ License
+ 
+ This tool is for educational and training purposes.
+ 
+ ## ğŸ¤ Support
+ 
+ For questions or issues, please contact the training organizers.
+ 
+ ---
+ 
+ **Built for Beijing Belt &amp; Road Enterprise Training Program**
```

import csv

print("="*80)
print("é‡æ–°ç”Ÿæˆå‡†ç¡®åˆ†ç±»ï¼ˆä¸å¼ºåˆ¶åˆ†ç±» + coalå½’èƒ½æºï¼‰")
print("="*80)

# è¯»å–æ•°æ®
with open('china_investment_tracker.csv', 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f:
    reader = csv.DictReader(f)
    data = list(reader)

# ä¿®æ­£åçš„å…³é”®è¯ - coalç§»é™¤
industry_keywords = {
    'é›†æˆç”µè·¯': ['semiconductor', 'chip', 'wafer', 'foundry', 'chipmaker', 'integrated circuit'],
    'ç”Ÿç‰©åŒ»è¯': ['pharma', 'biotech', 'drug', 'medicine', 'healthcare', 'medical', 'clinic', 'vaccine', 'therapeutic'],
    'æ–°èƒ½æºæ±½è½¦': ['electric vehicle', 'ev ', 'battery', 'auto', 'automotive', 'vehicle'],
    'çŸ¿äº§èµ„æº': ['mining', 'mineral', 'copper', 'lithium', 'iron ore', 'cobalt', 'nickel', 'zinc', 'rare earth']  # ç§»é™¤äº†coal, gold, silver
}

exclude_patterns = {
    'ç”Ÿç‰©åŒ»è¯': ['hospitality'],
    'æ–°èƒ½æºæ±½è½¦': ['carlson', 'carmike', 'carrefour'],
    'çŸ¿äº§èµ„æº': ['goldman']
}

def classify_accurate(row):
    text = (str(row.get('Sector', '')) + ' ' + 
            str(row.get('Subsector', '')) + ' ' + 
            str(row.get('Partner/Target', '')) + ' ' + 
            str(row.get('Investor', ''))).lower()
    
    matches = {}
    
    for industry, keywords in industry_keywords.items():
        should_exclude = False
        if industry in exclude_patterns:
            for exclude_word in exclude_patterns[industry]:
                if exclude_word in text:
                    should_exclude = True
                    break
        
        if should_exclude:
            continue
        
        for keyword in keywords:
            if keyword in text:
                matches[industry] = keyword
                break
    
    return matches

# ç»Ÿè®¡
industry_counts = {industry: 0 for industry in industry_keywords.keys()}
industry_projects = {industry: [] for industry in industry_keywords.keys()}
unclassified_count = 0

for row in data:
    matches = classify_accurate(row)
    
    if not matches:
        unclassified_count += 1
    
    for industry, keyword in matches.items():
        industry_counts[industry] += 1
        try:
            amount = float(row['Millions'].replace('$', '').replace(',', '').strip())
        except:
            amount = 0
        industry_projects[industry].append({
            'row': row,
            'amount': amount,
            'keyword': keyword
        })

print("\nç»Ÿè®¡ç»“æœï¼š")
print("-"*80)
print(f"{'è¡Œä¸š':<15} {'é¡¹ç›®æ•°':<10} {'è¯´æ˜'}")
print("-"*80)

for industry, count in industry_counts.items():
    print(f"{industry:<15} {count:<10}")

print(f"\n{'å…¶ä»–è¡Œä¸š':<15} {unclassified_count:<10} (ä¸å±äºä»¥ä¸Š4ä¸ªè¡Œä¸š)")
print(f"\næ€»è®¡ï¼š{len(data)} ä¸ªé¡¹ç›®")

# åˆ†æcoalçš„æƒ…å†µ
print("\n" + "="*80)
print("ç…¤ç‚­(Coal)é¡¹ç›®åˆ†æï¼š")
print("="*80)

coal_projects = []
for row in data:
    text = (str(row.get('Sector', '')) + ' ' + str(row.get('Subsector', ''))).lower()
    if 'coal' in text:
        try:
            amount = float(row['Millions'].replace('$', '').replace(',', '').strip())
        except:
            amount = 0
        coal_projects.append({
            'year': row['Year'],
            'investor': row['Investor'],
            'target': row['Partner/Target'],
            'amount': amount,
            'country': row['Country'],
            'sector': row['Sector'],
            'subsector': row['Subsector']
        })

coal_projects.sort(key=lambda x: x['amount'], reverse=True)

print(f"\næ‰¾åˆ° {len(coal_projects)} ä¸ªç…¤ç‚­é¡¹ç›®ï¼ˆç°å½’ç±»ä¸ºèƒ½æºï¼Œä¸åœ¨çŸ¿äº§èµ„æºä¸­ï¼‰")
print("\nTop 10 ç…¤ç‚­é¡¹ç›®ï¼š")
for idx, p in enumerate(coal_projects[:10], 1):
    print(f"\n{idx}. ${p['amount']:,.0f}M | {p['year']} | {p['country']}")
    print(f"   æŠ•èµ„æ–¹: {p['investor'][:50]}")
    print(f"   ç›®æ ‡æ–¹: {p['target'][:50]}")
    print(f"   è¡Œä¸š: {p['sector']}/{p['subsector']}")

# ç”Ÿæˆæ–°çš„CSVæ–‡ä»¶
print("\n" + "="*80)
print("ç”Ÿæˆä¿®æ­£åçš„CSVæ–‡ä»¶...")
print("="*80)

for industry in industry_keywords.keys():
    filename = f'æœ€ç»ˆå‡†ç¡®æ¸…å•_{industry}.csv'
    
    projects = sorted(industry_projects[industry], key=lambda x: x['amount'], reverse=True)
    
    with open(filename, 'w', encoding='utf-8-sig', newline='') as f:
        fieldnames = ['Year', 'Month', 'Investor', 'Amount_USD_Million', 'Partner_Target', 
                     'Country', 'Region', 'Sector', 'Subsector', 'BRI', 'Matched_Keyword']
        writer = csv.DictWriter(f, fieldnames=fieldnames)
        writer.writeheader()
        
        for project in projects:
            row = project['row']
            writer.writerow({
                'Year': row['Year'],
                'Month': row['Month'],
                'Investor': row['Investor'],
                'Amount_USD_Million': project['amount'],
                'Partner_Target': row['Partner/Target'],
                'Country': row['Country'],
                'Region': row['Region'],
                'Sector': row['Sector'],
                'Subsector': row['Subsector'],
                'BRI': row['BRI'],
                'Matched_Keyword': project['keyword']
            })
    
    print(f"âœ… {industry}: {len(projects)} ä¸ªé¡¹ç›® â†’ {filename}")

print("\n" + "="*80)
print("âœ… ä¿®æ­£å®Œæˆï¼")
print("="*80)
print("\nä¸»è¦å˜åŒ–ï¼š")
print("  1. âŒ ç§»é™¤äº†coal - ç…¤ç‚­åº”è¯¥å½’ç±»ä¸ºèƒ½æº")
print("  2. âŒ ç§»é™¤äº†gold, silver - è´µé‡‘å±ä¸æ˜¯é‡ç‚¹")
print("  3. âœ… ä¿ç•™copper, lithium, iron ore, cobalt, nickelç­‰å·¥ä¸šé‡‘å±")
print("  4. âœ… åªæ ‡è®°å±äºè¿™4ä¸ªè¡Œä¸šçš„é¡¹ç›®ï¼Œå…¶ä»–é¡¹ç›®ä¸å¼ºåˆ¶åˆ†ç±»")
print("  5. âœ… çŸ¿äº§èµ„æºç°åœ¨èšç„¦åœ¨metalsï¼ˆé‡‘å±çŸ¿äº§ï¼‰")

```bash
                'Subsector': row['Subsector'],
                'BRI': row['BRI'],
                'Matched_Keyword': project['keyword']
            })
    
    print(f"âœ… {industry}: {len(projects)} ä¸ªé¡¹ç›® â†’ {filename}")
```

import csv

print("="*80)
print("é‡æ–°ç”Ÿæˆå‡†ç¡®åˆ†ç±»ï¼ˆä¸å¼ºåˆ¶åˆ†ç±» + coalå½’èƒ½æº + æ’é™¤coalï¼‰")
print("="*80)

# è¯»å–æ•°æ®
with open('china_investment_tracker.csv', 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f:
    reader = csv.DictReader(f)
    data = list(reader)

# ä¿®æ­£åçš„å…³é”®è¯ - coalç§»é™¤
industry_keywords = {
    'é›†æˆç”µè·¯': ['semiconductor', 'chip', 'wafer', 'foundry', 'chipmaker', 'integrated circuit'],
    'ç”Ÿç‰©åŒ»è¯': ['pharma', 'biotech', 'drug', 'medicine', 'healthcare', 'medical', 'clinic', 'vaccine', 'therapeutic'],
    'æ–°èƒ½æºæ±½è½¦': ['electric vehicle', 'ev ', 'battery', 'auto', 'automotive', 'vehicle'],
    'çŸ¿äº§èµ„æº': ['mining', 'mineral', 'copper', 'lithium', 'iron ore', 'cobalt', 'nickel', 'zinc', 'rare earth', 'metal']  # ç§»é™¤äº†coal, gold, silver
}

exclude_patterns = {
    'ç”Ÿç‰©åŒ»è¯': ['hospitality'],
    'æ–°èƒ½æºæ±½è½¦': ['carlson', 'carmike', 'carrefour'],
    'çŸ¿äº§èµ„æº': ['goldman', 'coal']  # æ·»åŠ coalæ’é™¤
}

def classify_accurate(row):
    text = (str(row.get('Sector', '')) + ' ' + 
            str(row.get('Subsector', '')) + ' ' + 
            str(row.get('Partner/Target', '')) + ' ' + 
            str(row.get('Investor', ''))).lower()
    
    matches = {}
    
    for industry, keywords in industry_keywords.items():
        should_exclude = False
        if industry in exclude_patterns:
            for exclude_word in exclude_patterns[industry]:
                if exclude_word in text:
                    should_exclude = True
                    break
        
        if should_exclude:
            continue
        
        for keyword in keywords:
            if keyword in text:
                matches[industry] = keyword
                break
    
    return matches

# ç»Ÿè®¡
industry_counts = {industry: 0 for industry in industry_keywords.keys()}
industry_projects = {industry: [] for industry in industry_keywords.keys()}
unclassified_count = 0

for row in data:
    matches = classify_accurate(row)
    
    if not matches:
        unclassified_count += 1
    
    for industry, keyword in matches.items():
        industry_counts[industry] += 1
        try:
            amount = float(row['Millions'].replace('$', '').replace(',', '').strip())
        except:
            amount = 0
        industry_projects[industry].append({
            'row': row,
            'amount': amount,
            'keyword': keyword
        })

print("\nç»Ÿè®¡ç»“æœï¼š")
print("-"*80)
print(f"{'è¡Œä¸š':<15} {'é¡¹ç›®æ•°':<10} {'è¯´æ˜'}")
print("-"*80)

for industry, count in industry_counts.items():
    print(f"{industry:<15} {count:<10}")

print(f"\n{'å…¶ä»–è¡Œä¸š':<15} {unclassified_count:<10} (ä¸å±äºä»¥ä¸Š4ä¸ªè¡Œä¸š)")
print(f"\næ€»è®¡ï¼š{len(data)} ä¸ªé¡¹ç›®")

# åˆ†æcoalçš„æƒ…å†µ
print("\n" + "="*80)
print("ç…¤ç‚­(Coal)é¡¹ç›®åˆ†æï¼š")
print("="*80)

coal_projects = []
for row in data:
    text = (str(row.get('Sector', '')) + ' ' + str(row.get('Subsector', ''))).lower()
    if 'coal' in text:
        try:
            amount = float(row['Millions'].replace('$', '').replace(',', '').strip())
        except:
            amount = 0
        coal_projects.append({
            'year': row['Year'],
            'investor': row['Investor'],
            'target': row['Partner/Target'],
            'amount': amount,
            'country': row['Country'],
            'sector': row['Sector'],
            'subsector': row['Subsector']
        })

coal_projects.sort(key=lambda x: x['amount'], reverse=True)

print(f"\næ‰¾åˆ° {len(coal_projects)} ä¸ªç…¤ç‚­é¡¹ç›®ï¼ˆç°å½’ç±»ä¸ºèƒ½æºï¼Œå·²ä»çŸ¿äº§èµ„æºä¸­æ’é™¤ï¼‰")
print("\nTop 10 ç…¤ç‚­é¡¹ç›®ï¼š")
for idx, p in enumerate(coal_projects[:10], 1):
    print(f"\n{idx}. ${p['amount']:,.0f}M | {p['year']} | {p['country']}")
    print(f"   æŠ•èµ„æ–¹: {p['investor'][:50]}")
    print(f"   ç›®æ ‡æ–¹: {p['target'][:50]}")
    print(f"   è¡Œä¸š: {p['sector']}/{p['subsector']}")

# ç”Ÿæˆæ–°çš„CSVæ–‡ä»¶
print("\n" + "="*80)
print("ç”Ÿæˆä¿®æ­£åçš„CSVæ–‡ä»¶...")
print("="*80)

for industry in industry_keywords.keys():
    filename = f'æœ€ç»ˆå‡†ç¡®æ¸…å•_{industry}.csv'
    
    projects = sorted(industry_projects[industry], key=lambda x: x['amount'], reverse=True)
    
    with open(filename, 'w', encoding='utf-8-sig', newline='') as f:
        fieldnames = ['Year', 'Month', 'Investor', 'Amount_USD_Million', 'Partner_Target', 
                     'Country', 'Region', 'Sector', 'Subsector', 'BRI', 'Matched_Keyword']
        writer = csv.DictWriter(f, fieldnames=fieldnames)
        writer.writeheader()
        
        for project in projects:
            row = project['row']
            writer.writerow({
                'Year': row['Year'],
                'Month': row['Month'],
                'Investor': row['Investor'],
                'Amount_USD_Million': project['amount'],
                'Partner_Target': row['Partner/Target'],
                'Country': row['Country'],
                'Region': row['Region'],
                'Sector': row['Sector'],
                'Subsector': row['Subsector'],
                'BRI': row['BRI'],
                'Matched_Keyword': project['keyword']
            })
    
    print(f"âœ… {industry}: {len(projects)} ä¸ªé¡¹ç›® â†’ {filename}")

print("\n" + "="*80)

<details><summary>Tool use: **command** â€¢ Run command: cd /Users/qrebecca/china_investment_tracker && cat << 'PYEOF' > test_classification.py
import pandas as pd

# Load data
df = pd.read_csv('china_investment_tracker.csv')
df['Amount'] = df['Millions'].str.replace('$', '', regex=False).str.replace(',', '').str.strip()
df['Amount'] = pd.to_numeric(df['Amount'], errors='coerce')

# Keywords
INDUSTRY_KEYWORDS = {
    'Integrated Circuits': ['semiconductor', 'chip', 'wafer', 'foundry', 'chipmaker', 'integrated circuit'],
    'Biopharmaceuticals': ['pharma', 'biotech', 'drug', 'medicine', 'healthcare', 'medical', 'clinic', 'vaccine', 'therapeutic'],
    'New Energy Vehicles': ['electric vehicle', 'ev ', 'battery', 'auto', 'automotive', 'vehicle'],
    'Mineral Resources': ['mining', 'mineral', 'copper', 'lithium', 'iron ore', 'cobalt', 'nickel', 'zinc', 'rare earth', 'metal']
}

EXCLUDE_PATTERNS = {
    'Biopharmaceuticals': ['hospitality'],
    'New Energy Vehicles': ['carlson', 'carmike', 'carrefour'],
    'Mineral Resources': ['goldman', 'coal']
}

def classify_accurate(row):
    text = (str(row.get('Sector', '')) + ' ' + 
            str(row.get('Subsector', '')) + ' ' + 
            str(row.get('Partner/Target', '')) + ' ' + 
            str(row.get('Investor', ''))).lower()
    
    matches = []
    
    # Check target industries
    for industry, keywords in INDUSTRY_KEYWORDS.items():
        should_exclude = False
        if industry in EXCLUDE_PATTERNS:
            for exclude_word in EXCLUDE_PATTERNS[industry]:
                if exclude_word in text:
                    should_exclude = True
                    break
        
        if should_exclude:
            continue
        
        for keyword in keywords:
            if keyword in text:
                matches.append(industry)
                break
    
    # If no match, use original Sector
    if not matches:
        sector = str(row.get('Sector', 'Other')).strip()
        if sector and sector != 'nan' and sector != '':
            matches.append(sector)
        else:
            matches.append('Other')
    
    return matches

# Apply classification
df['Industries'] = df.apply(classify_accurate, axis=1)
df_expanded = df.explode('Industries')
df_expanded = df_expanded[df_expanded['Industries'].notna()].copy()

# Statistics
print("="*80)
print("åˆ†ç±»ç»Ÿè®¡ç»“æœ")
print("="*80)

industry_counts = df_expanded['Industries'].value_counts()

# Separate target industries and other sectors
target_industries = list(INDUSTRY_KEYWORDS.keys())
target_stats = industry_counts[industry_counts.index.isin(target_industries)]
other_stats = industry_counts[~industry_counts.index.isin(target_industries)]

print("\nğŸ¯ é‡ç‚¹è¡Œä¸šï¼š")
print("-"*80)
for ind, count in target_stats.items():
    print(f"{ind:<40} {count:>6} ä¸ªé¡¹ç›®")

print(f"\nğŸ“Š å…¶ä»–è¡Œä¸šï¼ˆå‰15ï¼‰ï¼š")
print("-"*80)
for ind, count in other_stats.head(15).items():
    print(f"{ind:<40} {count:>6} ä¸ªé¡¹ç›®")

print(f"\næ€»è®¡ï¼š")
print(f"  - é‡ç‚¹è¡Œä¸šé¡¹ç›®æ•°ï¼š{target_stats.sum()}")
print(f"  - å…¶ä»–è¡Œä¸šé¡¹ç›®æ•°ï¼š{other_stats.sum()}")
print(f"  - æ€»é¡¹ç›®æ•°ï¼š{len(df_expanded)}")
print(f"  - ä¸åŒè¡Œä¸šæ•°é‡ï¼š{df_expanded['Industries'].nunique()}")

# Check coal
print("\n" + "="*80)
print("éªŒè¯ï¼šçŸ¿äº§èµ„æºä¸­æ˜¯å¦è¿˜æœ‰coalé¡¹ç›®ï¼Ÿ")
print("="*80)
mineral_df = df_expanded[df_expanded['Industries'] == 'Mineral Resources']
coal_in_mineral = mineral_df[mineral_df['Subsector'].str.contains('Coal', case=False, na=False)]
print(f"ç»“æœï¼š{len(coal_in_mineral)} ä¸ªcoalé¡¹ç›®åœ¨çŸ¿äº§èµ„æºä¸­")
if len(coal_in_mineral) > 0:
    print("âŒ è¿˜æœ‰coalé¡¹ç›®ï¼")
    print(coal_in_mineral[['Year', 'Investor', 'Partner/Target', 'Sector', 'Subsector', 'Amount']].head())
else:
    print("âœ… æˆåŠŸï¼çŸ¿äº§èµ„æºä¸­æ²¡æœ‰coalé¡¹ç›®")

print("\n" + "="*80)

PYEOF

```bash
import pandas as pd

# Load data

df['Amount'] = pd.to_numeric(df['Amount'], errors='coerce')

    'Integrated Circuits': ['semiconductor', 'chip', 'wafer', 'foundry', 'chipmaker', 'integrated circuit'],
    'Biopharmaceuticals': ['pharma', 'biotech', 'drug', 'medicine', 'healthcare', 'medical', 'clinic', 'vaccine', 'therapeutic'],
    'New Energy Vehicles': ['electric vehicle', 'ev ', 'battery', 'auto', 'automotive', 'vehicle'],
    'Mineral Resources': ['mining', 'mineral', 'copper', 'lithium', 'iron ore', 'cobalt', 'nickel', 'zinc', 'rare earth', 'metal']
}

EXCLUDE_PATTERNS = {
    'Biopharmaceuticals': ['hospitality'],
    'New Energy Vehicles': ['carlson', 'carmike', 'carrefour'],
    'Mineral Resources': ['goldman', 'coal']
}

    text = (str(row.get('Sector', '')) + ' ' + 
            str(row.get('Subsector', '')) + ' ' + 
            str(row.get('Partner/Target', '')) + ' ' + 
            str(row.get('Investor', ''))).lower()

        should_exclude = False
        if industry in EXCLUDE_PATTERNS:

                    should_exclude = True
                    break

            continue

                matches.append(industry)
                break
    
    # If no match, use original Sector
    if not matches:
        sector = str(row.get('Sector', 'Other')).strip()
        if sector and sector != 'nan' and sector != '':
            matches.append(sector)
        else:
            matches.append('Other')
    
    return matches

# Apply classification

df_expanded = df.explode('Industries')
df_expanded = df_expanded[df_expanded['Industries'].notna()].copy()

print("="*80)

print("\nğŸ¯ é‡ç‚¹è¡Œä¸šï¼š")
print("-"*80)
for ind, count in target_stats.items():
    print(f"{ind:<40} {count:>6} ä¸ªé¡¹ç›®")

print(f"\nğŸ“Š å…¶ä»–è¡Œä¸šï¼ˆå‰15ï¼‰ï¼š")
print("-"*80)
for ind, count in other_stats.head(15).items():
    print(f"{ind:<40} {count:>6} ä¸ªé¡¹ç›®")

print(f"\næ€»è®¡ï¼š")
print(f"  - é‡ç‚¹è¡Œä¸šé¡¹ç›®æ•°ï¼š{target_stats.sum()}")
print(f"  - å…¶ä»–è¡Œä¸šé¡¹ç›®æ•°ï¼š{other_stats.sum()}")
print(f"  - æ€»é¡¹ç›®æ•°ï¼š{len(df_expanded)}")
```

```python
def get_industry_name(lang, industry):
    """Get industry name - translate if target industry, otherwise use original"""
    target_industries = list(INDUSTRY_KEYWORDS.keys())
    if industry in target_industries:
        return get_text(lang, f'industries.{industry}')  # ç¿»è¯‘é‡ç‚¹è¡Œä¸š
    else:
        return industry  # å…¶ä»–è¡Œä¸šç›´æ¥æ˜¾ç¤ºåŸå
```
